Except Cleaver doesn't help at all in that situation since when you Q, you only apply 1 stack and it applies AFTER the damage is dealt. Cleaver is a good item for him if you need the tankiness, but you're already at 30% CDR with just boots and Ghostblade, you're going into 50%, which is 10% over the cap for CDR. o.o The old Cleaver worked well for that build. 40% CDR, an extra 10 ArP, and more sustained damage, but the new one is iffy at best on him.

The Cleaver could be used with the basic attacks reduce the armor by 30% then with Varus having the max stack of W on the target, His Q will hit even harder. Jinx would be crying so much because she would want to be able to do the same. In some cases Varus may be able to do close to 1k dmg with a single Q without it being a crit.

Varus currently is used similarly to Nidalee where he's more of a Seige and Poke champ, which is why they're having him at mid rather than bot lane. 

Plus, you already have 39% ignore and 20 flat. Standard carry has 9 from runes, and since we mention Jinx, we'll use her base armor at max! That's 82.4, which is 91.4 in total. That's 39% ignored, which is 55.754, minus 20 is 35.754, divide it by 135.754 (Formula for Mr and Armor is Armor/MR divided by 100+Armor/MR respectively.). That's about 26.33% reduced damage. With a cleaver, you reduce the base by 30%, which is 63.98, then the 39%, which is ~39.03, minus 20, that's 19.03. Formula again gives us about 16% reduced damage. That means a Cleaver gives you 10% of your base damage more. You have to hit an enemy 6 fricken times to ONLY get a 10% damage boost against a squishy. Saying Jinx would be crying is silly since she'd be dead in 2 Q's regardless of a cleaver. 

Cleaver would be fine against a tank, but on Varus when you have CDR boots and Ghostblade, you have 30% CDR and your Q is going to hit for chunks. You could easily get a BT for proper sustain and more damage without wasting 10% CDR and being incapable of stacking that passive properly. Varus without AS can't really stack a Cleaver well. Better off letting your bruisers use the Cleaver.
That makes sense, you always try to stack the w two or three times before Q-ing. Not saying that this is optimal, but it makes sense.

The current Varus at mid, doesn't oftenly get near his opponents early on. He's more played like Nidalee where he pokes for ungodly amounts. He's a great Sieger and can do a lot of scary damage with a Ghostblade active and the Muramana when his targets try to get close. Cleaver would be good against the tanks, but as I showed the math up above, at max level, a squishy carry with 30% reduced armor with the 39% ignore and 20 ArP already only gives about 10% boosted damage. It'd give more against a tank, but you're running Varus for his poking ability, AoE CC, and such, not so much for his DPS since without AS, even with the Ghostblade, he doesn't do much DPS. Pretty much all burst.

Rude? I'm a Bronze III Varus mid, transitioning into the mid lane isn't too hard, and usually works well for me. Anyone can try Varus mid, as it is still somewhat skill reliant. Anyone of any ELO can take Varus mid with varying personal success. Sure, it does work better in higher ELO's with more focus on team compositions and whatnot, but that far from means that people of the lower ELO's shouldnt try it. That is an elitist idea.

I think what he said specifically about bronze and silver players was elitist, however, he was going in the right direction before that. These posts should recognize that solo queue (regardless of if you're bronze 5 or challenger) and ranked 5s in the LCS are completely different. Many LCS teams run champion picks and builds that are tailored around very specific team comps. In solo queue, people should really avoid playing varus mid every game if they want to have a consistently solid team comp as he is a rather gimmicky pick. If you want to main him, go ahead, but you'll never fit into as many teams as an annie mid main. 

The reason he doesn't fit into comps all that well is because he's an AD mid and unlike the other AD mid laners that are viable, he doesn't have good split pushing. Xerath works very similar to him, except Xerath is AP so he fits better into most teams.

Don't get me wrong though. If you have a sejuani jungle and a rumble top, Varus mid could work quite well. Just be careful with what comp you throw him into as a mid laner. 

Again, feel free to main whatever you want, but just understand that there are many other champions with similar play styles that are simply more viable because they fit better into more team comps. I think that's ultimately the point Beaverchief was trying to make, up until he made the low elo comment.
